page.title: 03LANGUAGE
page.content: {English}is universally spoken, although this area is adjacent to Wales. The{Welsh}influence is still evident among the older generation, and particularly those who have lived locally all their lives. Today, however, these people would converse in English. Children in the area, once educated at small schools in Rhydycroesau and Pant Glas, now go to primary schools in Oswestry or Selattyn, or to secondary schools in Oswestry, where all teaching is in {English.} A small number of children have private lessons in{Welsh}. A visit to Oswestry on its market day, Wednesday, will enable {Welsh}to be heard spoken on the streets, as many farmers from the west come to town on business.
